member.name: T:AVT.VmbAPINET.Vimba
member.summary:
The Vimba singleton class is the entry point to the Vimba API.
To start working with Vimba, call Startup() first.
After finishing work, call Shutdown().

member.summary: The raw memory buffer of the ancillary data .

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.AncillaryData.Close
member.summary: Drops access to the ancillary data inside a frame.
member.exception: Thrown on issues in the environment.

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.AncillaryData.Open
member.summary: Allows access to the elements of the ancillary data, either via feature access or via the raw buffer.
member.exception: Thrown on issues in the environment.
member.remarks: Since ancillary data is only valid for a single frame, but receives its definition from the camera the frame came from, it should be closed as soon as possible.

member.name: T:AVT.VmbAPINET.AncillaryData
member.summary:
AncillaryData encapsules additional data that was sent together with an image.
It is equivalent to GenICam's chunk data.

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.Feature.IsEnumValueAvailable(System.Int64)

summary.para: Indicates whether an existing enumeration-value is currently available.
An enumeration value might not be selectable due to the camera's current configuration.

member.param: int64 enum value to test.

exception.para: Thrown on issues in the environment. Possible ReturnCodes are:
- VmbErrorInvalidValue: If the given value is not a valid enumeration-value for this enum
- VmbErrorApiNotStarted: Startup() was not called before the current command
- VmbErrorInvalidAccess: Operation is invalid with the current access mode
- VmbErrorWrongType: The feature is not an enumeration

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.Feature.IsEnumValueAvailable(System.String)

summary.para: Indicates whether an existing enumeration-value is currently available.
An enumeration value might not be selectable due to the camera's current configuration.

member.param: String enum value to test.

exception.para: Thrown on issues in the environment. Possible ReturnCodes are:
- VmbErrorInvalidValue: If the given value is not a valid enumeration-value for this enum
- VmbErrorApiNotStarted: Startup() was not called before the current command
- VmbErrorInvalidAccess: Operation is invalid with the current access mode
- VmbErrorWrongType: The feature is not an enumeration

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.Frame.Fill(System.Drawing.Bitmap@)
member.summary:
Fills the given bitmap with current buffer data in an appropriate pixel format.
If bitmap is null, an appropriate object will be created and filled with frame data.
If bitmap is not null, the existing object will be filled with frame data.
For more details, see chapter "Converting Frames into Bitmaps" in the Vimba .NET manual.
member.param: Reference to a bitmap.
member.exception: Thrown on issues in the environment or bitmap failure.

member.name: P:AVT.VmbAPINET.Frame.Buffer
member.summary: Returns the complete buffer including image and chunk data.
member.exception: Thrown on issues in the environment.

member.name: P:AVT.VmbAPINET.Frame.AncillaryData
member.summary: Returns the part of a frame that describes the chunk data as an object.
member.exception: Thrown on issues in the environment.

member.summary: Closes an interface. Will free the access to this interface.
member.exception: Thrown on issues in the environment.

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.Interface.Open
member.summary: Opens an Interface. Will provide access to an interface.
member.exception: Thrown on issues in the environment.

member.name: T:AVT.VmbAPINET.Interface
member.summary:
An Interface object represents a logical interface as provided by the underlying transport layers.
Before opening it with Interface.Open, only static properties can be queried.
After opening, the interface features are accessible.

member.summary: Sets Load/Save settings behaviour
member.param: Determines which feature shall be saved/loaded
Determines how many iterations shall be used during loading

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.Camera.LoadCameraSettings(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the current camera setup from an XML file into the camera
member.param: Determines name and/or path of xml file to be loaded

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.Camera.SaveCameraSettings(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the current camera setup to an XML file

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.Camera.ToString
member.summary: Returns the name of camera.

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.Camera.StopContinuousImageAcquisition
member.summary: Stops streaming and frees the used frames
member.remarks: This is a convenience method. Deregister the FrameObserver again.
member.exception: Thrown on issues in the environment.

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.Camera.StartContinuousImageAcquisition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts streaming and allocates the needed frames.
member.remarks:
This is a convenience method.
Register a FrameObserver and queue the received Frame(s).
member.param: count of Frame(s) which should be used for this method.
member.exception: Thrown on issues in the environment or when the passed frame count is invalid.

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.Camera.AcquireMultipleImages(AVT.VmbAPINET.Frame[]@,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets multiple images synchronously and returns the number of valid frames.
member.remarks: This is a convenience method, doing all the necessary startup methods and cleanup afterwards.
member.param: Reference to array of empty Frame objects. The size of the array determines the maximum number of images to grab.
timeout how long it should wait for the image (in milliseconds). The timeout is used for each image, not for the whole sequence.
number of frames with valid frame data.
member.exception: Thrown on issues in the environment or when the passed Frame array is invalid.

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.Camera.AcquireMultipleImages(AVT.VmbAPINET.Frame[]@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets multiple images synchronously.
member.remarks: This is a convenience method, doing all the necessary startup methods and cleanup afterwards.
If a timeout is encountered, the method is aborted.
member.param: Reference to array of empty Frame objects. The size of the array determines the exact number of images to grab.
timeout how long the method should wait for the image (in milliseconds). The timeout is used for each image, not for the whole sequence.
member.exception: Thrown on issues in the environment or when the passed Frame array is invalid.
Thrown if acquisition times out.
Thrown on issues in the system environment.

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.Camera.AcquireSingleImage(AVT.VmbAPINET.Frame@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Acquires one image into a Frame.
member.remarks: This is a convenience method, doing all the necessary startup methods and cleanup afterwards, so using it in a loop will be relatively slow. Instead, consider using AcquireMultipleImages or StartContinuousImageAcquisition
member.param: Reference to an empty Frame object. It will contain the image after the call.
Timeout how long it should wait for the image (in milliseconds).
member.exception: Thrown on issues in the Vimba environment.
Thrown if acquisition times out.
Thrown on issues in the system environment.

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.Camera.WriteMemory(System.UInt64,System.Byte[],System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Writes a block of memory. The number of bytes to write is determined by the size of the provided buffer.
member.param: start address to write.
array of data buffer.
Reference to an uint. The number of read memory bytes will be saved to this variable.
member.exception: Thrown on issues in the environment or when the length is invalid.

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.Camera.ReadMemory(System.UInt64,System.Byte[]@,System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Reads a block of memory. The number of bytes to read is determined by the size of the provided buffer.
member.param: start address to read.
Reference to array of data buffer. Memory will be saved to this array.
uiReadLength determines how many bytes to read.
Reference to an uint. The number of read memory bytes will be saved to this variable.
member.exception: Thrown on issues in the environment or when the length is invalid.

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.Camera.WriteRegisters(System.UInt64[],System.UInt64[],System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Writes one or more registers consecutively. The number of registers to write is determined by the number of provided addresses.
member.param: Array of addresses. Size of address buffer determines how many registers to write.
Array of register data.
Reference to an uint. The number of written registers will be saved to this variable.
member.exception: Thrown on issues in the environment or when the address/data array is invalid.

member.name: M:AVT.VmbAPINET.Camera.ReadRegisters(System.UInt64[],System.UInt64[]@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Reads one or more registers consecutively. The number of registers to read is determined by the number of provided addresses.
member.param: Array of addresses. Size of address buffer determines how many registers to read.
Reference to array of data. Registers will be saved to this array.
Reference to an uint. The number of read registers will be saved to this variable.
member.exception: Thrown on issues in the environment or when the address array is invalid.

member.name: T:AVT.VmbAPINET.Camera
member.summary:
A Camera object represents a physical camera.
Before opening it with Camera.Open, only the static properties can be queried.
After opening, the camera features are accessible and you may acquire images.
